SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Update the Page Labels for Site Admin Email on Exception Pages

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) patch 3.147.7 or later fixes the page labels that render an email address to the site administrator. This email address appeared on the default Visualforce pages for exceptions or navigation errors: ccrz.CCException, ccrz.CCFileNotFound, ccrz.CCInMaintenance, ccrz.CCUnauthorized, and ccrz.CCUnderConstruction. If you rely on these default exception pages, update your page labels after you install the patch.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Salesforce CompatibilitySalesforce not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.


B2B Commerce Compatibility

Any solution upgrading to or installing B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) patch 3.147.7 or later

IMPORTANT Complete these steps in Salesforce Classic only. The rich text editor in Lightning Experience can introduce extra HTML tags that affect this page label.
On the CC Page Labels tab in your org, search for labels named Site_Get_In_Touch.
For each page label named Site_Get_In_Touch, complete the following steps:
Click Edit.
In the ValueRT field, highlight the linked {1} variable.
Select Link .
In the Link window, enter the following values:
FIELD	VALUE
Display Text	{1}
Link Type	E-mail
Email Address	{0}
Click OK.
Click Save.
TIP
If you localize your storefront, also create a localized page label record.
If you've enabled page label caching, refresh the cache after you modify page label records to show your updates on the storefront.
SEE ALSO
Edit Page Labels

Let us know so we can improve!

No
title: Updating Visualforce B2B Commerce Page Labels
